title: Exam Scores | 2 of 2
question_text:
Created for Albert.io. Copyright 2016. All rights reserved.

These side-by-side stemplots represent the scores on the final exam for a statistics teacherâ€™s $1^\text{st}$ period class $(n = 29)$ on the left and $5^\text{th}$ period class $(n = 22)$ on the right. The scores are raw scores, out of a possible $100\text{ points}$.
Which of the following statements is true?

choices.text: If the two sets of data were combined into one set, the new distribution would be nearly normal.
If the data for the two groups were combined, the overall mean would be the average of the means of each group.

If the data for the two groups were combined, the range would be unchanged from that of
1
st
period.
The two groups have similar standard deviations.
The two groups have similar skewness in their distributions.
